intro: Vicia nana, commonly known as the dwarf vetch, is a small, herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters, featuring small, trifoliate leaves and clusters of pale yellow to violet flowers. The plant produces small, lens-shaped pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. Vicia nana is noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial in soil enrichment.
